ygData.subject: AW: Question on getting into Dragon raids
ygData.msgSnippet: Xegony does not use a master calendar to my knowledge for the simple fact that we have too many personalities on Xegony. Cooperation is sometimes limited and
ygData.messageBody:
Xegony does not use a master calendar to my knowledge for the simple fact
that we have too many personalities on Xegony. Cooperation is sometimes
limited and we have whole guilds of folks that simply don't play well with
others. Rule of thumb is whoever gets there first and god help you if you
get wiped out first try. Dragons on Xegony usually die pretty fast, although
Vox is a bit off the beaten track and can be up a bit longer than most. I
would guess the aveage lifespan of a dragon on Xegony to be no more than a
couple hours. You may consider parking a toon that can track in Perma.
My advice is still to try and get into Ragefire camps for red scales and
watch for Gore as much as possible. If you can get into a Vox/Naggy raid, do
it. It will probably take you several levels before you have all the pieces.
Helping people with Gore/Vox/Nag/Trak/Rage gets your name known and brownie
points built. You will need them if you spot Vox up and when you get ready
to spawn Trak for your last step. My guild has some Vox level toons and we
need a frost book for one of our main paladins. If you spot her up one
night, give me a tell and we will see who we have that can come help.
We did finally get Kaas' epic finished this weekend. Ever had the luck to be
sitting in Trak's lair, waiting on the undead bard only to have Trak spawn?
What fun!

Brilinnia Ban'Sidhe
Venator Sapentia, Xegony
